intro: Maesobotrya brevispicata, commonly known as the short-spined maesobotrya, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, sparsely branched shrub form. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are unisexual, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants, a feature typical of many members of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
